intro: Rosa viscaria proles laevipes, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a shrub-like plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its thornless stems and broad, ovate leaves with a smooth, waxy texture. The plant produces fragrant, pink to reddish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
